column4: I can't install the firefox dev files. I get   Depends: mozilla-firefox (=1.0.2-0ubuntu5) but 1.0.7-0ubuntu0.1 is to be installed
have you installed firefox from backports?
this is the version of Firefox that installed with the install CD. It looks from the Depends error like the dev code is older than the binary?
i think from that error, you should upgrade to mozilla-firefox 1.0.7 first
I *am* running 1.0.7. And the depends error confirms this. But the dev code that Synaptic is finding is apparently older, and this appears to be the problem.
geez. I should have tried that. Now it works! Thanks.
So I am doing this to install the latest version of mplayer plug-in, as opposed to the 2.70 version on the repo. Is this dumb? Am I going to screw something up?
no it won't screw things up
try "sudo killall alsa" and then "sudo alsa &"
actually I just tried "sudo /etc/init.d/alsa restart" which seemed to work. Is this in essence doing the same thing?
yes it's the same thing, and what you did is a better way than what i just told you :)
okay, thanks. BTW I think you were the one helping me with the mplayer plug-in install. It all worked out. I have 3.11 now in Firefox. Firefox still quits on me sometimes though...
yes it does. I thought it was related to the mplayer plugin. Now I am not sure.
if you want to do some test, you could remove the mplayer plugin and test the firefox, if it's run fine, then it has something to do with the mplayer plugin
